entry.title: Three Keys to Driving Business Through Marketing
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

The other day I had the wonderful opportunity to speak at Siena College, where I majored in marketing and graduated from in 1991. I spoke to the students about marketing and how I managed to grow my business.

So, to cut to the chase, I'll share some of the more important points that I spoke about with the students.
  • Using marketing to differentiate yourself: If you do what everyone else does, you'll get what everyone else gets. Don't do what everyone else is doing. You need to make people investigate why you're different and why this is beneficial to them.
  • Track your marketing: We spend money to advertise on television, radio, and the internet. However, you have to figure out what's bringing in leads and what is not. Once you figure out what's working for you, your marketing budget is much easier to handle. If you could spend $1 and bring in $2, you'd be spending that money all the time.
  • Risk reversal: Nobody likes taking risks, and that's why we offer our guaranteed sale programs. It's a great piece of marketing, because we still sell homes and we also keep our customers happy. This also forces us to work really hard in order to ensure the customer's happiness. 

Once you have a solid marketing plan in place, you'll go from chasing business to attracting business. The goal of your marketing should be to attract inbound calls, and this way you don't waste time calling people who may not be interested in doing business with you.

By the way, I never do this but I have a fantastic property on 109 Willow St. in Guilderland, NY. It's only $479K, and it's a 4 bedroom-4-bathroom Colonial-style masterpiece! At 4512 sq. ft., it's only $109 per sq. ft.! If you have any buyers, I could cut you in on 3% of that sale.

Please call me anytime with any questions or concerns you might have with me.

link.title: Three Keys to Driving Business Through Marketing

entry.title: For Success in Real Estate You Need to Understand the Lifetime Value of a Client
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

Are you interested in an evening of eating and drinking, as well as a free limo ride - all on the house? If so, sit tight and I'll explain.

But first...

One thing many agents don't understand is the lifetime value of a client. Over the last week I went on several listing appointments and realized that several of the homes had sold in the last four years with agents who are still in the business, but the homeowners did not call their past Realtors. Why would that be? 

It's pretty obvious why the homeowners didn't call their past agents: they didn't know them. Those agents didn't have a system of follow up to stay in touch with past clients. The Realtor sold their home five years ago, thanked them, gave them a closing gift, maybe wrote them a Christmas card, but never systematically followed up with the client over the years. If you want to grow a meaningful database and a strong business, you can't orphan past clients. 

I follow up with ALL of my past clients with a written newsletter once a month, two videos a month to create value for them, and birthday and anniversary cards when we can. On average, we're touching our past clients 30 times a year! We lend a Bounce House to past clients, we have a raving fan club we let use the tools in our office, and do a bunch of other things to stay in touch with
our past clients. 

If you do one thing today, I want you to sit down and think about your past clients and what you can do to better communicate with them. Try to remember clients that loved you and who you feel comfortable giving a call - you may be able to pick up a referral from it! Building a business is about building a database and maintaining past relationships, plain and simple. 

Now, back to the free food, drink, and limo ride. Once a month, my team has a game night in our office, where we eat, drink, play games, and talk real estate. If this sound likes fun to you, I would be happy to send a limo to your house to pick you up, so you don't have to worry about driving after a few drinks! Spouses are welcome, and we would love to have you! 

If you have questions about game night or would like more advice on how you can build your business, give me a call or shoot me an email. I would love to hear from you!

link.title: For Success in Real Estate You Need to Understand the Lifetime Value of a Client

entry.title: What's the Secret to Sustaining Success?
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

People always want to know how I became so successful and what I do to further my success. I often tell people to take their five closest friends and to compare their incomes with your own. You'll probably find that you're all earning about the same amount. 

I've always thought that I'm never the smartest or wealthiest person in the room, but I constantly try to surround myself with people that are more successful than I am. I have never hesitated to take advice from a mentor or to go to a conference to learn from other successful business people.

There have been countless times where I've gone to conferences, exchanged information with the brightest minds in the business, and then implemented their expertise in my own business. Each and every time this has helped me to improve my business.

It's okay to admit that you're not as successful as the person next to you, because the only way to learn is from others. For example, I sat down and talked to one agent who paid her listing agents hourly, not on commission, and her profits soared. I came back and implemented this strategy, and during a sale I made $14,000 in commission while paying my listing agents only $400 in labor. 

There's a saying that I've always thought to be pretty true, "If you're the smartest guy in the room, then you're in the wrong room."

If you really want to grow exponentially, then you need to surround yourself with people that are more successful than you. You can learn a lot from these people, and you'd be surprised at how willing people are to share their expertise with you. All you need to do is ask.

Thanks for tuning in again, and if you ever need any advice, please know that I'm here to share it with you!

link.title: What's the Secret to Sustaining Success?

entry.title: Can a Simple Thank You Note Make All the Difference?
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

Today I'm speaking to you from our brand new office that we purchased. We haven't even had a chance to decorate it, but since we purchased the space we can do what we want with it, which would be nice for a change. 

However, today I'll be speaking about the elusive power of the Thank You note. I recently received a Thank You note from a previous client (to be honest, a very difficult client with an expired listing) who was responding to a Christmas gift that we try to send out to all of our clients. The point is that I didn't feel as if this client was very happy with us at the time, but in her Thank You note we received two referrals, which ended up in two home sales for us. 

When you write Thank You notes effectively, it should make your client feel good, and in turn it will make them feel good referring you to other people. 

If you're on a budget and can't afford radio ads or anything too sophisticated on the internet, I urge you to spend fifteen dollars on some Thank You notes and see what it can do for you. People love to see hand written notes, and it will surely have an impact on the people you send them to. Just be sure to send them often, and to a lot of different people that you've done business with. 

Spending an hour per day writing these notes might be one of the most productive things you can do. Forming relationships is important in this business, and this is a solid way to do it.

A side note: We're looking to hire another real estate agent with the desire to succeed and make a 6-figure income. We're growing fast and need talent, so give me a call on my cell phone if you think that you would make a good fit.

Otherwise, if you have any questions about Albany real estate, please don't hesitate to contact my team or me. Have a wonderful day!

link.title: Can a Simple Thank You Note Make All the Difference?

entry.title: How Can You Make 2015 Your Best Year Yet?
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

Welcome back to my real estate coaching blog! Today, I just want to recap 2014 and take a look ahead at 2015 and what you can do to make it your best year yet. 

Our business improved between 25% and 28% in 2014, so we want to say thanks to all the agents who have co-broke a transaction with my firm this year. It means the world to us! If you co-broke a transaction with us this year that did not go smoothly, call me directly at 461-9937, as my goal is always to make the transaction go as smoothly as possible for anyone we are working with.

Recently, I had a conversation with a veteran agent who was complaining about how her numbers were down dramatically in 2014. She's doing the same marketing she always has, yet her business has dropped around 5%, which is the market average. The question is, Why?

I explained that we're seeing a shift in the industry. We're starting to see a much younger crowd grab a tremendous amount of market share. They're doing this through internet-based leads. Many older agents don't want to purchase online leads, but the reality of the situation is that sites like Trulia and Zillow play a very important role in real estate today.

In 2014, I spent over $100,000 on internet-based leads, but literally brought in a multiple of that in volume - after all, we did around $42 million in sales this year. It's hard to compete with a firm that's spending that kind of money if you're an individual agent, but you still have options.

Give me a call if you would like help generating internet-based leads. It's my specialty, and I can show you how you can start generating online leads for as little as $50 a month. Referrals are also a very important aspect of this business, but internet-lead generation MUST be a part of your business if you want 2015 to be your best year yet. 

Have a great 2015! I look forward to hearing from you soon!

link.title: How Can You Make 2015 Your Best Year Yet?

entry.title: Are You Unknowingly Hurting Your Chances of Success?
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.


Welcome back to the Clancy Coaching Blog! Thanks for spending a few minutes with me today, I know your time is very valuable.

Today, I want to talk about the power of written goals. As we approach the end of 2014, there is no better time to sit down and map out your goals for next year. Looking at the numbers of all the agents in my office, I noticed one thing: those who wrote down their goals for 2014 outperformed the agents who did not...BY FAR. My written goal was to get 100 transactions this year, and it's looking like I'm going to do just that!

Magical things can happen when you commit things to writing. By physically jotting down your goals, you have a vision for the future and a target to shoot for. In our office, we use business assessment forms, as well as 2015 commitment forms, which are great ways to get your whole team to start thinking about next year. 

I would love to mail you the forms we use to get our team ready to achieve big things the next business year. If anything, simply take 15 to 20 minutes and make a plan. How are you going to generate business in 2015? Answer that question and stick to it - I promise you'll see results!

Give me a call if you have any questions or concerns about planning for the future. I would love to give you a hand!

link.title: Are You Unknowingly Hurting Your Chances of Success?

entry.title: How to Improve Your Lead Conversion
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

How to Improve Your Lead Conversion

Thanks for joining us today. We created this blog to share with you some coaching tips, some things we have learned over the years. 

Today we want to talk to you about the most important part of growing your real estate business, lead conversion. With the advent of online lead generation, even a monkey can generate 1000 leads a month, but a typical agent can handle only about 50 leads per month. 

Our team generates between 300-400 leads a month, but the lead conversion is what is most important. 

For lead conversion, there are 2 primary aspects that we are sure you have heard before, but cannot be understated: Speed of follow up and persistence.

If you call within 5 minutes of getting a lead, you are 92% more likely to convert that lead. We have a system in place where the lead gets a text message instantly and one of our agents follow up within 5 minutes.

We realize that not everyone has access to these resources. If you aren't able to reach your leads that fast, there is technology to help you for as little as $20 a month. If you have any questions about this for us, give us a call. 

Now, onto persistence. We have a great story to share with you about being persistent. Our first million dollar sale was from an internet lead that we called 15 times before we got him on the phone. He was referred to another agent who didn't call him back, but the fact that we called 15 times got us the listing, and a $27,000 commission. 

92% of sales take place after the 8th call, but 95% of people stop calling after 4. If you stop after 4 calls, you are missing out on the bulk of the sales business.

Our team always calls until we reach someone. We use texts, mass texts, voice mail, and email to reach our leads.

We'd be happy to share our systems with you to show you we get our lead conversion rate where it is. 

If you have any questions about converting leads, or are curious about joining our team, give us a call anytime. We'd love to share our expertise with you.

link.title: How to Improve Your Lead Conversion

How to Make Your Real Estate Dreams a Reality

We created this blog to share with you some of the real estate coaching tips we have learned over the years working with some of the best real estate coaches in the world. We recently had an opportunity to sit down with some of the top producers, coaches, and agents in the country in a real who's who of the real estate industry. 

Top producers like Jay Kinder, Lars Hedenborg, Curtis Johnson and Mark Spain were agent that we looked up to 7 years ago when we got started in this business. Those were the guys that not long ago we were watching from afar at conferences and masterminds, wondering how they got where they were.

Well, we can tell you from experience that we all have the same thing in common. Everyone at this table had a vision and knew what they wanted, knew what they were willing to give up to realize that vision, and how to set up systems and processes to get there. 

If you feel you are struggling with your career, don't give up! Let's sit down and talk. You really can do 100, 150 transactions a year if you set goals, have a vision, and know how to get there. entry.title: Dealing with Rejection and Finding your Why
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

Dealing with Rejection and Finding your Why

This last week, we attended a conference in Las Vegas with over 3,700 of the best agents in the country. We got to share some great ideas with others, and we learned many things as well. One of the best things we learned is that the #1 key to success as a Realtor is the ability to deal with rejection. The person that can deal with getting the most "no's" will sell the most homes. Once you learn to deal with this, it will turn your career around in dramatic fashion.

When I started out as an agent, I was pretty shy and timid. I didn't want to pick up the phone and call people because I was afraid of people hanging up on me or having to deal with rejection. Once I overcame that obstacle, however, I went from selling a few homes a year to selling much, much more.

The key to dealing with rejection is finding your why. Why do you do what you do? Why do you sell real estate? Once you find a why in your life and it becomes big enough, your ability to deal with rejection becomes easier and you give up the need to be liked by everyone you come in contact with.

Your success in real estate really comes down to how you handle rejection, and what your "why?" is. If you have any questions about dealing with rejection or finding your "why?", please feel free to give us a call or email. I would be glad to sit down with you and discuss things over a cup of coffee.

link.title: Dealing with Rejection and Finding your Why

entry.title: Why Specialization is Key in the Real Estate Industry
entry.content:
Looking to improve your real estate career? I'm here to help you make a smart decision when it comes to growing your business, improving your bottom line, and choosing a place to work in real estate sales. If you'd like to learn more about working with Clancy Real Estate, contact me at (518) 861-7016 or Kevin@ClancyRealEstate.com.

Why Specialization is Key in the Real Estate Industry

We have learned so much over the years working with some of the best real estate coaches in the country. The advice from these coaches helped us sell over 100 homes a year. Today we want to talk to you about changes in the industry and why teams are starting to dominate an area traditionally held by individual real estate agents.

Real estate teams are dominating for one reason, specialization. You wouldn't see a general practitioner for brain surgery, so why would you hire a real estate agent who list homes, and works with buyers, and does marketing, and hosts open houses. You wouldn't, and shouldn't. Teams are built of specialists. A team of listing assistants, listing coordinators, operations managers, and buyer's agents will beat a single agent every day of the week.

Our team currently consists of 2 listing assistants, 3 buyer's agents, an operations manager, and a listing coordinator, each with their own specialized area. With a team, lead generation is done independently, so you don't have to worry about spending a good portion of your day on that. This frees agents up to simply follow leads and convert them to sell homes. If you specialize in one thing, you are going to be better at that thing and the client experience will be better as well. We work in a complex industry and if you specialize in one area, it will improve your performance.

You may see that you enjoy working just with buyers or just with sellers. We use a test called a DISC test to see where you're best suited. If you are interested in seeing where your services are best suited in the real estate industry, please send us an e-mail or call us directly. We would love to sit down and talk with you about where your talents would best suit you in real estate. In the meantime, if you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact us. We would love to help you out.

link.title: Why Specialization is Key in the Real Estate Industry
